name: Manbhum Ananda Ashram Nityananda Trust
briefDescription: MANT is a non-profit, non-racial, non-political, non-religious development organisation registered with the Government of West Bengal, India in 1959-60, working in the field of Basic Education, Health Improvement and Livelihood Development targeted to ameliorate immense sufferings of the marginalized section of the contemporary society and empower them to strive for their own development in the districts of Purulia,  Jalpaiguri, Paschim Medinipur, Bankura, Birbhum, Dakshin Dinajpur, and Kolkata of West Bengal, India.  The core programmes of MANT includes rural voice promotion programme through Community Radio, health service delivery through Mobile Medical Camps, Tribal RCH, Total Sanitation Campaign, Save Girl Child & Tobacco Control.
